item.title: Ticket #3496 (Two CDATA sections needed to work with 'application/xhtml+xml' mime-type) created
item.dc:creator: JeremyVisser
item.description:
In wp-includes/general-template.php, there are two JavaScript sections related to the TinyMCE editor, where if Content-type: application/xhtml+xml is specified in the HTML headers, the Write Post page will fail to load.

This is because Firefox will parse a page served with application/xhtml+xml with an XML parser, as opposed to an SGML parser.

The XML parser apparently doesn't like the two ampersands (&&) in the JavaScript code, and bombs out. Adding CDATA tags around the code fixes the problem.

Attached is a ready-made patch.

Ticket priority is 'low', because not many people use the application/xhtml+xml for WordPress, but severity is 'blocker', because the Write Post page breaks.

item.title: Ticket #3411 (If file uploaded aren't images, dont' link them with an image) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
Status changed

Attached provides:

  1. get_attachment_icon_src(): URL of the whatever's first: thumbnail, image, mime type icon.
  2. wp_get_attachment_url(): URL of attachment file.
  3. wp_get_attachment_thumb_file(): Path to thumbnail file on server.
  4. wp_get_attachment_thumb_url(): URL of thumbnail file.
  5. wp_attachment_is_image(): (bool)
  6. wp_mime_type_icon(): takes mime type or attachment_id

Reworks:

  1. get_attachment_icon(): uses get_attachment_icon_src().
  2. Upload manager: uses all of the above.
  3. Send to editor screen now offers the appropriate subset of {thumbnail, full size, title, icon} under "Show:" menu.

I didn't go through everything to see where these new functions should be used, but I think I caught most of it.
